title: Processes - Area of Region - Functions of x

content.question: What is the area of the region in the first quadrant that is bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 2 to the x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>, and the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="8 minus, the fraction with numerator 3, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 3, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 15, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="8 minus, the fraction with numerator 3, and denominator the natural log of 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
